definitions.definition: Knowledge of the future ; understanding of something in advance, especially as a form of supernatural or extrasensory perception.
The practice of taking a factual statement from a witness before a trial .

main_definition: ( parapsychology ) Knowledge of the future ; understanding of something in advance, especially as a form of supernatural or extrasensory perception. [from 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( Scots law ) The practice of taking a factual statement from a witness before a trial . [from 17th c.]
